message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with the application of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) for language modeling, which is a problem in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is a likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a Bayesian learning algorithm for RNNs, which involves stochastic gradient Markov Chain Monte Carlo (SG-MCMC) and model averaging, indicating a focus on machine learning (ML) and probabilistic modeling. Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses RNNs for various applications, including image captioning, speech recognition, and text classification, suggesting a possible connection to computer vision (cs.CV).
